author: SHARON LING
title: Ex-MP fined for animal cruelty
text:
by sharon ling Found guilty: Some of the accused leaving the courtroom after being fined RM500 for cruelty to animals. 
KOTA SAMARAHAN: Former MP-turned-businessman Datuk Sng Chee Hua was among a group fined by the magistrate’s court here for taking part in an illegal cockfighting session. 
Sng, 70, along with 24 others pleaded guilty to a charge of animal cruelty in front of magistrate Marutin Pagan yesterday. 
Sng and the other accused, aged from 20 to 63, were fined RM500 each in default one week’s jail. They were accused of committing the offence at a warehouse in Taman Berlian here at 3.35pm on Feb 5. 
They were convicted under Section 3(1) of the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Ordinance, which carries a penalty of three months’ imprisonment or a fine of up to RM500. 
They were among 320 men arrested in a police raid on a cockfighting pit at the Taman Berlian warehouse on Feb 5. Police also seized 21 live and three dead roosters as well as cockfighting spurs, gambling chips and cash during the raid. 
Deputy public prosecutor Nor Azhari Yusof prosecuted while counsel Arthur Lee appeared for Sng. 
The other accused were unrepresented. All of them settled the fine. 
Sng is formerly the MP of Julau. The one-term MP, who was once dubbed a colourful politician and fluent in Iban language, was elected in 1995.
